>>52740950
The color scheme does a lot of heavy lifting here. Red and blue are complimentary colors but don't actually work well on characters unless some clever blending is used. So her leggings fade from red to blue, the red matching her hair and eyes and the blue matching her sweater. The sweater has some brighter blues around the color and hood.

She's very curvy, which is mentioned a lot, but this is further highlighted by her sweater ending just about where a miniskirt would, revealing most of her figure while also keeping her warm, making it practical.

Her hair is short and simple, but very bright. The sweater is considerably darker than rest of her which allows her face and of course her thighs, to stand out considerably more than they already do. Her hair being short draws you to her eyes almost immediately which are just piercingly red, and erotically shaped. Red is a color of intense passion.

You are made to notice everything that pertains to sexual stimulation as fast as possible, because her designer is extremely perverted.

A lot of good analysis already in the thread but I figure I would point out that her leggings having a color gradient is really smart, it draws your attention to the extremes on either end, especially the red which is a more eye catching color, matches her hair and eyes, and not to mention is extremely warm. They slapped it on her ass but then playfully hid it underneath her jacket so it draws your attention but all you can really get is an idea of what the color at the top might look like and how her body might be shaped under there. It's perfectly simple, leading your eyes straight to her ass and then letting your imagination fill in the blanks. There's absolutely no way her designer didn't intend for that and it reveals a bit of playful lewdness to her character without her having to say a word. That's my interpretation at least.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52760148
I've seen some theories that Geeta might be Nemona's sister. I thought it was dumb at first, but I've actually become delusional enough to start believing it.
In Japanese, Geeta speaks like a fancy rich lady, which would fit with Nemona's family being rich. Nemona is one of the only people who has anything good to say about Geeta, which could be due to them being related. Similarly, Nemona seems to want Geeta's approval despite having already beaten Geeta in battle, which makes more sense if she looks up to Geeta as more than just a trainer.
Geeta also says how she's not used to seeing Nemona be so excited, which implies she's known Nemona long enough to have an idea of how she normally acts. Also Geeta calling Nemona to let her know you became a champion makes a lot more sense if they're close enough to talk outside of official situations.
I just think it would be really cool if the DLC focuses on both Nemona and Geeta, leading up to them revealing that they're both related.

Geeta takes a deep interest in people with talent so I don't think her keeping a close eye on Nemona is anything odd. She pretty much does the same with you to the extent of randomly barging into your room and then immediately wanting to come to your house too(and has Larry working 3 jobs in an attempt to get him to give a fuck about battling). I don't think them being siblings would add much in the first place since they already have an interesting relationship and parallels in their writing. They're both isolated by their talent and passion and Geeta is envious of your relationship with Nemona and clearly wanted someone to clash and grow alongside herself. All they need is the screentime.
I wouldn't particularly mind if it ended up that way but I just don't see it. Nemona clearly knows who her sister is and it would be very weird for her to just not have brought up that it's Geeta the whole game.

>>52762822
It would be filler yes, but it would be considered a good one. I'm not sure if I agree with Adamant that it's the best episode in the last 6 years but it's definitely up there. The devil's in the details. It hits the right emotional notes:
>relatable loss of child story as its base
>episode moves at a decent pace and rarely feels bogged down by franchise shit like "here's this new Pokemon"
>most importantly, Ash actually reacts like a human kid to the events
Most of the episode is fairly predictable, but Ash crying at the end of the episode and not really understanding why he is crying is what skyrockets it into kino territory. He's subconsciously realizing how sorry he feels for the kid and how much he values his own parents after seeing how much pain Haruto's parents went through from losing him. It's a good story not tied down by shilling a Pokemon of the week and just seeks to tell a relatable story that happens to have Pokemon in it.

>>52742630
His opinion does matter because he would be familiar with the creation process. He's one of the key founders of the Pokémon series and he's basically right. Look at the video posted, the girl speaks of Pokémon as if she was talking about dogs and the scenes shown in the video show how Pokémon even act like obedient dogs. Why would Gengar wait 3 years for it's owner instead of acting like it states on the dex? Why did it act like an obedient dog rather than the scary monster it's described in the pokedex? The anime even shows Gengar eating dry food like a dog, clearly not a scary monster as in the dex but a creature that's closer to a dog more than anything. The dex can serve as a cool backstory and play a role but depiction takes precedent over it and depicting Pokémon as cute and innocent critters is foremost more important than anything else hence why the Pokémon company is very anal about depiction of Pokemon and very meticulous in the way they're depicted.

And what you mention is common in all media.
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingAnimal
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntellectualAnimal
None of the characters listed stop being animals/pets just because of their abilities, they're still constructed to be pets/animals. Snoopy may be able to write a novel but he's still very much Charlie Brown's dog in the way he's treated and acts. Likewise we know the same with Pokémon because of Tajiri's statements and even statements from The Pokémon Company. This is why Pokémon share universal pet behaviors like zoomies or chewing on shoes like in HGSS or as why the player bathes and cleans them like one does their pet, this implies Pokémon can't clean themselves, or as to why we see things like pet beds in Scarlet and Violet. The games and anime are constructing Pokémon as cats and dogs despite their fantastical nature and we have statements proving it's deliberate.

Things like that play big role in reception to PKMN

>>52744671
I fail to see how it's irrelevant because Pokémon doesn't exist in a vacum. You live in a world where apparently these things dislodge Pokémon from their intended space which they don't. Not only do you chose to ignore actual words from the people who run the series but also the many ways in which the series chooses to contextualize Pokémon. Nothing in Pokémon Snap ending suggest the girl is naive, verily so the point of Pokémon being attuned to the feelings of people and showing trust and love when shown love by people was a major point in Legends of Arceus such as NPCs remarking on the love the MC has for their Pokémon and even the lady at the pasture proclaiming Pokémon must want to be friendly with people since they're not running away from the pastures. Also it's never implied that the gengar bonded with it's trainer, instead it's revealed the trainer started to detest the gengar nevertheless it chose to be a good boy and await for it's owner. Likewise many abandoned Pokémon, like Ash charmender chose to wait for their owner and in Charmander case even if it meant death and enduring more abuse. The reception to the Gengar episode among children was one of sadness, many proclaimed to have cried at it's backstory because it has an element of pet innocence to it, indeed one reddit post called it the jurassic bark of Pokémon.

With all that in mind this construction is very powerful to the point that it greatly influences reception to Pokémon even in the NSFW sphere and as to why so many people have issues with sexualization of any Pokémon, they act cute and innocent and many people perceive Pokémon as occupying the space of critters in universe, and not just any critter but also the space of cats and dogs.

Of course I'm not alone here, as I mentioned you see this perception every on mass media. But as an example a rolling stone article for detective pikachu states that "Pokémon are like dogs" and that the movie is a "dog movie".

>>52753422
Because fire/fighting is a decent defensive typing, it's defense stats aren't bad at all, it can hit hard enough without attack investment, it has intimidate to nueter physical attackers, and it also has Will O Wisp to screw them up even further. With the meta as hyper offense focused as it is now,these are all good traits to have. Also, there isn't any fire/fighting competition, but even if there were, none of them are very good defensively because of shitty defense stats. So it'll always have a niche.

Honestly, it's extremely underrated. I don't see it being OU honestly, but it's a solid UU mon.

>>52761041
toxic orb/black sludge are some of the only ways a tatsugiri can take damage inside of dondozo, so often people bring an annihilape to final gambit an enduring tatsuggiri or revavroom/electrode to explode and bring tatsugiri down to low health, bring in dondozo to get the omni-boost as the tatsugiri dies from poison damage which lets you bring in a Costar Flamigo that will copy the boosts from Dondozo. This strategy is why you see Murkrow on every fucking team now because if you don't have a way to deal with it, you're often fucked. This particular set-up has died off in usage however as you're effectively left with 2 pokemon left which isn't great, as Tatsugiri isn't exactly a weak mon on it's own, so instead people just try to bait out your murkrow/amoonguss early to get them down and able to play with the boosted dondozo.

>>52761880
That's awesome it got you into online competitive battles!
Here's my wholehearted suggestion as someone who finally got a damn grasp of what everything means back in Gen 6, play to have fun.
Focus on using favorites and build around them, try a number of team building styles to see which works best for you. Me personally I'm a fan of balanced and hyper offensive teams. I'd avoid worrying about numbers and entirely avoid meta picking. It's fine if a mon you like ends up being a meta mon, but there's truly nothing more soulless than an entire team of copy/paste meta sets.

Me personally I have used a number of my favorites, built teams around them, tried new pokemon I've never touched before, made new favorites, and have accomplished breaking numerous top 500 tiers to varying degrees in both single and doubles across 3 generations.

Pokemon is about having fun catching and using those pokemon for battle. The mechanics aren't that difficult to teach, and I'd honestly extend the offer to teach you myself if you want a personal better understanding.

Despite the valid dissenters and those that have never played pokemon competitively about showdown, it's an excellent resource in trying new things on a dime without much commitment, so you find out what DOES work to then commit to it in game, which by the way has been made a billion times easier this generation compared to ones prior, an absolute massive win in my opinion!

If you'd like to know an omega powerful set with Polteageist, have a mon that is capable of setting up psychic terrain, have it faint or switch in on a prediction that involves you not getting hit (it's risky), make sure your polteageist has weak armor, a focus sash, and shell smash with stored power, shadow ball and a fairy coverage move for dark types, and you will have a borderline unkillable sweeper, the likes only other sashed mon can deal with or a scarfed ditto.
The psychic terrain helps out massively because it blocks ALL priority moves so you won't get gibbed by a revenge killer.

>>52760181
It's worse than that.
They favor tournament players above ladder players, despite ladder players being the majority of the playerbase.
And low ladder players and high ladder players have a lot more in common with each other than either of them do with tournament players.
Playing in a tournament is like playing a different game because losing just one battle is a much bigger deal and the RNG doesn't even out like it does with many ladder matches.
That's why they're so strongly against RNG-based strats, generally unviable meme strats, and things that force 50/50's, and why they favor stall (an extremely safe playstyle) so much.

>>52755261
>I think people meme on Gen 4 too hard
Not possible. It has a really off-putting dex in my opinion, and the cross gen evos are a big part of that. The designs feel very rough, with many of them trying (and failing) to do something cool in the most surface-level way possible. Some are passible, but even those don’t live up to the originals. Worst part is the actual gameplay design; many of the evos are just straight upgrades, meaning the original has no gameplay value (and very little hope of gaining a buff) if it can’t make practical use of eviolite. Love them or hate them, at least some (all?) of the modern cross evos leave room for the original mon to be useful / different.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52748590
Call of Legends is at the tail end of low print runs for pokemon cards. Card collecting was losing popularity during neo, and really lost popularity during e-series onward. Reflecting the lower sales, Pokemon lowered their print numbers to reflect lower demand. Low print numbers really start during Neo Destiny, and continued all the way through e-series, ex-series, and gen4 cards. The final set of gen4 was Call of Legends. A special set already, full of semi-reprints (new artwork but same attacks). It wasn't a failure, but it was just released as a small print run during a time when print runs were already tiny. I think Call of Legends may be one of the lowest printed around (along with things like ex doexys and skyridge). As a result, those Shiny Legend cards are among the rarest ultra rares around. If there ever is nostalgia and hype for those cards in the future, their prices could eclipse that of gold stars simply due to their rarity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52749115
It's fun, sometimes. Playing it casually online or offline with friends is definitely fun, playing against tryhards and coomers is a different story.
You should start playing the solo mode on Master Duel to learn the game, maybe watch some short tutorials on YouTube about all forms of summoning, chaining, important rules of the game, just the basics. Once you get to understand the game mechanics, that's where the fun begins.
If you'd like to build your own deck, you'd be better off starting with 3x structure deck (most SDs have a portion of great cards, meh cards and not so great cards, just keep the best and other useful ones) and throwing in some staples. If you'd like to see if your deck is any good, download EDOpro (Project Ignis) and start fucking around with it, it's totally free and you can play with all cards. That are my 2 cents.
If you don't know how many times you have to put a certain card into your deck, just remember:
>3 times = card you want in your starting hand
>twice = important, but not necessary to start with, or cards you can easily search for
>once = it's a card you can easily search for or isn't that important for your engine
I'm currently playing a Kashtira deck and it's so much fun running that deck, unfortunately Fenrir and Unicorn will most likely become limited next year.
Have fun!

I have a new theory for why skin prices are insanely absurd: They're working towards a gacha endgame.
So, let's say 2 years down the line, they'll have over 100 skins available to buy. That's when they'll introduce some gacha BS that allows you to roll for skins for maybe 100 gems plus an EXTRTEMELY timegated way to get free rolls. If the chance for a skin to drop is like 5% (with item enhancers, gold, or holotickets clogging up the rest of the percentages), players will look at this as an opportunity to "game" the system and spend money the might've not before. The 50% chance to get a 2,500 gem skin for only 1,000 gems (plus the other progression goodies they'll get through "failed" rolls) will look tempting, and suddenly you'll have players willing to spend money when they might've not before, along with an increased chance of creating or attracting new whales to the game. The worst part is, this new system will be hailed by the community as nothing but a positive addition to the game since it'll exist on top of the current systems, not replace them, even though it's obvious that they're working towards this from the start.

> Survivor
If the Pokemon with this ability is pulled out of the battle with less than 25% health, their attack will be boosted by one stage when they're swapped back in. For every fainted Pokemon in the party, this boost will be increased by an additional stage. This ability only triggers once a battle.

Stat drops terrify this Pokemon so much that they also gain a speed boost. Moves meant to drop their speed will raise it by two stages instead.

>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

I agree, OP. I mean, seriously:

Do you like an entire dex filled with hundreds of shitty designs?
Do you like dialogue that consists entirely of outdated obnoxious pop culture references?
Do you like shitty puzzles and overly confusing map design?
Do you like a lack of basic QoL like HM moves being mandatory to progress?
Do you like an overly linear region with very little to see or explore?
Do you like a Victory Road where every trainer has 6 Pokemon to make it as tedious and unfun as possible?
Do you like a nonsense plot that tries to go serious and edgy in the last 20 minutes?
Do you like trying to find low chance encounters in the Safari Zone or who will immediately blow up if you want to complete the dex?
Or a 1:1 recreation of the DPPt Feebas puzzle?
Do you like the 2nd gym having Ice Beam and perfect coverage on the statistical equivalent of Slowbro while you're still using unevolved shitmons?
Or maybe do you like the 3rd gym using Electric Terrain and BoltBeam before you've gotten any decent TMs?
Would you like it if the game gives you the Thief TM but then barely any trainers have anything to steal?
Do you enjoy when trainers have maxed out EVs and IVs long before the game ever gives you the resources to have the same?
Do you enjoy that when the game does give you those resources, it becomes pathetically easy?
Do you enjoy a postgame that's full of blatantly unfinished features and areas?
Do you enjoy the game REEEing at you and deleting your save file if you dare to cheat (despite the fact its an easy workaround anyway?)
Do you enjoy a soundtrack full of shitty meme songs?
Do you enjoy tranny devs who only added in Radical Reddit tier (((balance))) changes in the latest update because people were destroying their game with broken mons?
Do you enjoy a fan base filled with autistic fags from Reddit?

Then you'll frickin LOVE Clover. Such an awful and shi-I mean wonderful game, g-gotta fit in with the hivemind, my bad.

You're isolating the stats Slowbro is better in, though. SJWhale has better HP, special bulk, and even the defense is comparable at best. Also at that level, even though it does half of Slowbro's Special Attack, this doesn't translate into an extreme loss of power:
>Lvl 20 0 SpA Starmie Water Pulse vs. Lvl 20 0 HP / 0 SpD Mew: 10-13 (13.1 - 17.1%) -- possible 6HKO
>Lvl 20 0 SpA Starmie Water Pulse vs. Lvl 20 0 HP / 0 SpD Mew: 16-21 (21 - 27.6%) -- 20.5% chance to 4HKO
It's only double strength if you consider the absolute minimum and maximum rolls, and considering SJWhale's immense bulk compared to everything at that point in the game it can easily score 2HKOs, let alone the fact you can't actually wall it with anything.

>>52703814
Sydney gets some boost with Sp Att this week, so someone who can reliably debuff that would be good. Also applies team wide paralysis before sync which fucks your regen. As a budget team I would try:
3* Marley Arcanine gives speed boost and can protect/cure the paralysis
Ghettsis with Glaciate spam can usually slow cheese one fight paired with a tank and some combination of speed booster, poisoner, sp def debuffer, or healer.
4* Viola Masquerain reduces the full team's Sp Att and can play special tank.

>>52723997
If you’re putting money in this game, than getting the 20 day login packs are definitely the deal, as well as the $1 gem pack that always happens whenever we get a new Masterfair (although right now they’re gone since it’s already been like a month since Cale, and Serena were added), New Years will also have a good bundle, $8 and you get 2022 or 2023 gems.
You only really want to use paid gems on selector multis, or on a step up for a new seasonal pair that you seriously like, want, and where you really don’t have any f2p gems for them (I definitely do not recommend doing every step at all), also save paid gems for the 25 of every month so you can do the 25 gem multi. Single pulls are also good to go if it’s a with increased rates like a fair banner, and then using f2p gems to do multis a few days before it ends if you didn’t get the featured you wanted.

If you powered up Ghetsis during the Unova VA, he does fine numbers as an Ice DPS, you just need units to buff him regardless of their types. Ice has always been lacking, mainly because most of them are limited to fair and season exclusive. Same with fairy, especially fairy.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.sub: Pokémon se volvió una mierda en los últimos años
posts.com:
Hola, onions un usuario que a seguido a la franquicia e interesado el genero RPG desde los remakes de "Gameboy Advance" de 3ra Generación (Pese a no haber probado los juegos titulares de esa generación, quiero decir Ruby y Zafiro).

Pero bueno, independientemente del cariño que le tenga a estos juegos, pienso que tuvo su punto de quiebre entre los juegos Black and White / Black and White 2 (las considero una expansión a la historia base).
Pues con el nivel de calidad de aquellas ultimas entregas de la franquicia para la Nintendo DS, su conversión a 3DS, con el lanzamiento de X Y, significo un notorio bajón de calidad, dificultad, narrativa y un cambio en el publico de la franquicia, no me mal entiendan, Pokémon siempre a sido un juego con temática relativamente infantil. Sin embargo, con la llegada de Diamante, Perla y Platino se vio un aumento de profundidad en sus temas, tornando así los juegos un poco mas oscuros, dándole entonces un aire relativamente fresco y siendo un cambio positivo, el tiempo pasa, y el publico que creció con los juegos va creciendo con nuevos intereses.

X e Y volvieron al tono infantilizado de la franquicia con un arte en pokemones ya no tan grotesco como los originales de la 5ta Generación. Las cosas empeoraron con la 7ma generación, un intento fallido de evolución de formula, volviendo los juegos un poco mas lineales de lo que ya eran de por si, tornándolos mas repetitivos, no entrare en muchos detalles, pues no llegue a terminar estos juegos por el aburrimiento generado.

Las nuevas generaciones... Ni hablar... el intento de evolución fracasando en el intento, la apuesta por un mundo abierto vacío y aburrido, sumado a los gráficos asquerosos que presentan sus ultimas entregas (Vergüenzas graficas para una maquina como la Switch, mas poderosa que la Xbox 360 o PS3). Deja a Pokémon como un gigante del pasado, el cual lamentablemente ya no es lo que fue en sus mejores días, es decir, la 4ta y 5ta Generación.

>>52749268
Not so much that. Aside from obvious reasons, like an anthro form being quite pleasant to hug and whisper nice things to as you sleep, my aversion to the human form is moreso because the sight of it, and the touch, especially, reminds me of the bodies I see on the job.
And the resultant negative emotions of grief, repulsion and loss.
A good amount of the problem is emotional, see. Blood and guts is blood and guts, I worked in my grandpa's butcher shop part time and figured that out, but death is decidedly more... human.
Especially if its some teenager. You hear so much about their future. How kind and lovely and smart they were. But then they decided they were sober enough to drive home when they shouldn't have, or they misjudged the speed of a turn or how far away a tree was. Even something so innocent as forgetting their seatbelt.
Then? Well, they're oh so much flesh that bounced off the tarmac, just getting pecked at by crows. Every last lick of uniqueness and humanity, their soul if you wanna go there, well, its gone, split to the wind. One might even go so far as to wonder if it was ever there in the first place, if the human mind and sentience is but a trick of oh so many carbon atoms and chemical energy put in a funny shape, and entirely ceases to be when those randomly arranged bits and bobs come apart.
But you don't need, or want, to hear about my personal thoughts. I'll tell you a funny story instead, because thats what imageboards are for. That and posting cute pokemon pictures.
Once had an ex, right. One of those chicks whose super into true crime podcasts and serial killer documentaries, that sort of thing.
Well, fella, there's a reason she's my ex. She thought it was hot that I thought of dead people when I saw her naked. Ain't that just nutty, huh?
Anyways, drive responsibly, all. There's likely someone out there who cares a good deal for you.

The yandere meta has been updated edition

>post fanfics you like
>share your own fics, ask for advice, post story updates
>discuss writerly struggles with fellow writefriends

Previous Thread: >>52598753

Check out the catalog for a directory of fics from fellow writefags: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PtN4D_9CSw8JJ9uO6v0oQqdtKEkS8aFAvfxqI96XfSE
Gallery of art drawn for stories in the thread: https://imgur.com/a/sjdck

>Can I post NSFW fics?
There are no rules against NSFW text links.

>How should I post my fics?
If it's short enough to fit into a couple of posts, posting to the thread is fine. If you want to share longer works, or if you want more permanent storage, you can link to a host: fanfiction.net, AO3, Pastebin, or Google Docs.

>I'm not a writer but I want to contribute
Feel free to give stories posted a read and critique as you see fit. Keep it relevent to the story.
>Can I request something?
You're encouraged to post prompts, i.e. short snippets or greentext sequences describing your ideas. You can also expand on prompts posted by others. If writing an entire story from start to finish feels too daunting, this is a way to get started.

>I have this idea about [event/technology/...]
Feel free to post your thoughts about how specific parts of the Pokémon world function as well. Worldbuilding is always welcome.

>Can I add a fic I wrote to the catalog?
Check the catalog for the submission link. Fill out the form with all the necessary information and it will be submitted for review automatically.

We're also looking to collect ideas for fanfics as a resource for stumped writers. Feel free to throw an idea out there; someone may choose to use it themselves!
Ideabin: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1X072SSWulcC6RJRrPA6v9XtyohRybvMBl6Fh49wHsRw

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52756163
>Maybe it's time to make doubles default.
I don't want to say it will never happen, but I don't expect it. Pokemon was never seriously designed as a competitive game until arguably decades after it was first created. It was probably originally meant as a fun side activity the same way Streets of Rage or Double Dragon has a versus mode. I don't think that design philosophy has really fundamentally changed.

Comp being doubles was probably more of a consequence of them seeing how cancerous the singles meta was when people tried a few tourneys of it back in Gen 3 or whatever. They obviously do cater to comp in some fashion nowadays with Pokemon and items specifically designed for it, but all that is still "hidden" behind the main games and anime which almost solely focus on singles.

The funny thing is that not only has doubles not become more prominent, they've probably become less relevant than ever. There's what, like 2 double battles in all of SV's single player? And no Battle Tower where you can practice the format either.

tl;dr Comp is and always has been a secondary concern, Pokemon is a goo goo gaa gaa baby game before anything else.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52756645
It doesn't, if you're operating under normal human logic.
But Smogon prefers precedent and consistency over logic and common sense. They ban things entirely, not just the obviously broken element.
I understand banning Blaziken over Speed Boost because other mons with Speed Boost aren't broken. Sure.
I understand banning Dracovish over Fishious Rend because Arctovish is complete dogshit even with it. Yeah.
And I understand wanting to avoid complex bans, because then you get into slippery slope cases like saying Mega Rayquaza would be fine in PU if it only knows Mud Slap.

But the literal only difference between banning Houndstone and banning Last Respects is that banning Houndstone removes more.
And banning moves isn't unprecedented or too complex, since they've banned shit like Baton Pass and Swagger.

I'm not fundamentally against the concept of banning and understand that in some cases it's necessary to keep the meta balanced, but Smogon is far from infallible.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hey friends, I've been wanting to relive the days when I actually enjoyed this fucking series, so I figured I'd do a Nuzlocke challenge like the good old days. Gonna play the era I enjoy, GBA/DS. Sort of a region-travel playthrough. FireRed, SoulSilver, Emerald, Platinum, and White.

Rules aside from the normal:
>Champion Clause: Any Pokemon, living or dead, that makes it to the HoF in one game has its line stricken from all subsequent ones. This includes split evos like Eevees or Hitmons.
>Set battle style
>Wild Pokemon and Starters randomized to within the same power level to make catches actually somewhat interesting in regions with poorly-distributed Regional Dexes

Starting off with a choice of Totodile, Pichu, or Ralts with Brock as my first gym leader makes things easy, though it does unfortunately give Boomer's rival, Zoomer, what he called "an easy dub no cap fr fr" with a two-shot Thundershock. Thankfully, I don't consider the Nuzlocke to start until after Rival 1, so here we go!

Time for Brassius. Decided to put Ember on YankeeDoodle again, Sudowoodo might take more from that than Flame Charge.
>Vs Brassius
>Petilil
Two Flame Charges make quick work of it. YankeeDoodle barely feels the Mega Drain inbetween.
>Smoliv
Two Flame Charges are once again enough. The Tackle inbetween doesn't do much.
>Truleewoodo
I'm well aware a Rock Throw is coming, so I have YankeeDoodle terastalize into a Normal type.
Ember does less than a third to the Gym Leader's ace. Rock Throw does fairly big damage even with the weakness removed.

I swap in Jock McGraw, but Trailblaze does well over half. I take what damage I can with Fake Out before switching out again. I go for Douce Dame, who takes Trailblaze with no issue. Two Ice Shards finishes off the fight, even if Rock Throw does some nasty damage.

>>52760612
Be in an area the pokemon can spawn normally.
Eat an encounter power 2 sandwich, if dual type mon the one which has less overlap in that area.
Keeping the game open, set the clock back 1 minute, then return to game and let outbreaks reset.
Repeat until desired outbreak occurs, keeping in mind that there are multiple rarity pools of outbreaks so some will be much more common even if you're tilting the odds in favor of something else.

https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>>52714969
For Enigma you need to surround a plot with 4 random berries, each in a specific direction. You get the hints from the Kanto Berry Master, which can take some time depending on your luck. The mutation chance itself is very low.

Next to Rowap are Kee and Maranga. Their mutation chances are not as low as Enigma, and the setups are simpler, just surround your target plot with a Liechi and a Ganlon (for Kee), or a Salac and a Petaya (for Maranga). I recomend you get those two first, so the berry master can only give you Enigma hints.

This is farmModal.html, what I did is add a div with the row class and add the col-8, then add another div with class col-4 for the berry data, when you use Bootstrap grid, the 100% of the container is col-12, so you can use col-8 and then another div with col-4 to get two columns taking the 100% of the container, more than 12 will move the column below

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52724545
In the col-4 div, I added
><!-- ko using: App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() -->
To get the ID of the selected berry, then I just copypasted the content of the modal-body from the berryDexModal.html file into it
The ko using line grabs the value in App.game.statistics.selectedBerryID() and then you can use said value with $data, the modal also uses $data so you don't need to modify anything from the modal
Here's ko using documentation: https://knockoutjs.com/documentation/with-binding.html

I'm shit explaining stuff so tell me if you didn't understand something
Also, in the link that calls the modal, change the href from href="#berryDexModal" to something else so it doesn't open the modal, after you tested everything, remove anything related to the modal

>I renamed the setting from berryUnits to sizeUnits
Remember to replace all instances of berryUnits with sizeUnits
>highlighted part
From what I understand, that's not how enums work, either you use the the dot with the size unit or you use the [] with the index number
So it's something like SizeUnits.Imperial or SizeUnits[0]
Also, iirc settings are saved as strings while array indexes are number, if you want the setting value to be a number you need to use parseInt() or Number()
